itemDescription: English recipient of the Victoria Cross

wikipedia_page.main: Charles Pye  (chr: 24 September 1820 – 12 July 1876) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: *Charles Pye VC (1820 in Stafford – 1876) sergeant-major, recipient of the Victoria CrossFind a Grave website, Charles Pye  Retrieved 27 January 2018.

link_mentions.page: List of English Victoria Cross recipients
response: |Charles Pye || British Armyb|| 1857 || Indian Mutiny || Lucknow

The local cemetery is the Tower Hill Cemetery located on the South Eastern slopes of Tower Hill.  The first recorded burials at the Tower Hill cemetery began in 1859. Charles Pye, an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, died in Kirkstall on 12 July 1876 and is buried at Tower Hill.
*Sergeant Major Charles Pye, Indian Mutiny (17 November 1857)
* Charles Pye (1820–1876), British soldier, Victoria Cross recipient
